intro: Cymopterus utahensis var. monocephalus, commonly known as the Utah lomatium, is a perennial herb native to the arid regions of the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and umbel-like flower clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Its flowers are small and white, producing a distinctive, aromatic scent. The species is notable for its medicinal properties and historical use by indigenous peoples.
